WRITING.TITLE: An alternative to banana "ice cream"...
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been seeing a lot about the whole "freeze a banana and blend it thing" and offer an alternative to it for those who don't like bananas or want something different:
Frozen mangos. They. Are. So. Good.
I literally eat them from frozen because they have a really silky texture and won't hurt your teeth. I buy the frozen chunks from walmart ($4.97 CAD) and blend it with stevia, water and a squirt of no sugar drink mix. It comes out like sorbet and is surprisingly filling.
It has only 90 calories for 3/4 cup of the pieces but 21g of sugar so it's a good treat to have if you're craving something sweet.

ELI5: Calorie intake when food is purged.
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been searching the web for a clear answer and there's always two sides to it.
I just want a clear answer: let's say someone binges on 1000 calories. Immediately after, they go and throw it all up until nothing comes up. Are all the calories gone? Will they gain weight?
Is it just the food that's actually in your stomach that turns into fat?

This is a simple lemon cake that's just a vanilla cake recipe with added lemon zest, lemon juice and yellow food colouring.
I made lemon curd by heating sugar and flour, adding lemon zest, juice and water and then cooking until thick.
It has a simple buttercream I flavoured with lemon and coloured yellow.
I made fondant with marshmallow and icing sugar which turned out less than stellar, but still got the job done.

WRITING.TITLE: Accepting that I can't have kids
WRITING.TEXT:
When I was little I used to watch a show called 'A baby story.' I oohed and aahed at the miracle that life was and became enthralled with the thought of being a mom one day. I used to stuff my shirt so it looked like I was pregnant. I then 'gave birth' to my baby(a stuffed animal) and fed and rocked it.
Somehow life always has a way of screwing up your dreams. As I grew older, I struggled with being who I was. Mental illness broke though in my teen years and shredded every hope I had to be a successful person apart. I could no longer function as kids my age did; I couldn't sleep, barely ate or even left my house. Depression had me in an iron grip.
I soon realized that mental illnesses run in my family. As does heart disease and horrible genetic acne. I came to see that if I do have kids, they would end up exactly like me. They would have to suffer what I suffer through. They would hate me the same way I hated my mother for having kids knowing all the genetic disadvantages that'd be passed down. They'd be forced to be raised by a mother who can't even take care of herself.
In the end, is this really sad? I don't know. I guess there's something in every woman that makes us want to be a mother one day. Unfortunately for me, I just can't see myself as a mom anymore. I can't raise a kid that will end up hating their life: wishing they were never born.
I just can't do it. But it's okay to dream...

Sorry for the horrid quality of picture.
I used giadas recipe for dough: www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/pizza-dough-237338
It's super easy and fast. Didn't even use my stand mixer.
Cheese: Bring to boil two cups milk. Add 1/4 cup white vinegar and let stand for 10 minutes. Add salt and put into a cheesecloth for 45 minutes. Form into a ball and store in fridge until you use it.
Sauce: Saut one minced onion and two cloves chopped garlic in oil until browned. Add one can tomato paste, one can tomato chunks and one jar tomato sauce(I used my sauce I made in the summer). Bring to a boil and add salt and herbs. Turn down heat and simmer for 2-4 hours or until reduced significantly.
Roasted garlic: Cut top of garlic bulb off and peel outer layer. Drizzle with oil and salt and wrap in foil. Bake in oven for 1 hour at 400 degrees.
Pizza:
Preheat oven to 500. Oil a pizza pan and punch dough down. Spread dough and bake in oven for five minutes. Take out and layer garlic, sauce and crumble cheese on top. Bake for addiction all 5-10 minutes or until golden brown under neath. Broil and take out.

They may look ugly but these are the best oat squares I've ever made.
Recipe
1 cup coconut oil 1 medium ripe banana 1 tbsp fruit jam 1 1/2 cups sugar 2 eggs 1 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda Pinch salt 1 cup flour 4 cups oats Cinnamon to taste
Preheat oven to 375 f. Combine all ingredients and place into greased square pan. Dust cinnamon on top and place in oven. Bake for 30-40 minutes and cool.

WRITING.TITLE: What is something people complain about in life that can easily be fixed?

WRITING.TEXT:
Usually when hosting parties that just involve drinks and apps you can do whatever you want to. Include a cheese platter and pair it with some wines that compliment each cheese. You can make some mixed drinks as well.
If you really want to impress people, you could make some homemade pretzel bites with a beer and cheese sauce. They are so simple to make and you could easily double the recipe.
As for sweet, one of my favourite party snacks are rum balls, which there are numerous recipes for online. You can vary the flavours which is always good. And to stick with every thing being mini, you could make mini cupcakes and decorate them with your initials.
Sorry if I couldn't be any more of a help. I recommend searching on Pinterest for some easy and fun recipes and ideas.
Congrats and good luck!!
